message_system

Class AttendeeMessageController

  • java.lang.Object
    • message_system.AttendeeMessageController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OrganizerMessageController, SpeakerMessageController

    public class AttendeeMessageController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller class. Allows for Attendee user interaction with the messaging system. Attendees may add friends to start conversations with other Users and they can message each other within those conversations. Is a parent class of OrganizeMessageController and SpeakerMessageController as they both inherit AttendeeMessageController's basic functionality.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AttendeeMessageController

        public AttendeeMessageController(User user,
                                 UserManager um,
                                 EventManager em)
        Creates a new instance of AttendeeMessageController and handles the deserialization of the local cm.ser file into a ConversationManager for the program to use.
        Parameters:
        user - The user currently logged in (of type "a" for attendee)
        um - A reference of the UserManager to use and modify
        em - A reference of the EventManager to use.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is to be called immediately after instantiation of AttendeeMessageController. Gives prompts and handles user input which gets directed to appropriate helper methods. This method serializes the ConversationManager to the local cm.ser file.

      • handleAddFriend

        public void handleAddFriend(java.lang.String input)
        Helper method for the run() method. Method expects a username to be passed and tries to add that user to their friends. Also handles generating a new conversation between the two users.
        Parameters:
        input - The name of the friend the user is entering

      • handleConversations

        public void handleConversations(java.lang.String input,
                                java.util.ArrayList<Conversation> conversations)
        Helper method for the run() method. Method checks if the input is numeric and is a valid index of conversations. Upon the conversation selection it creates a screen for the user to type in further inputs for messaging in the chosen conversation.
        Parameters:
        input - The selection of index of conversation. Should be numeric but cleans up if not.
        conversations - The list of conversations for the user to select and interact with.

      • handleMessageAll

        public void handleMessageAll(java.util.ArrayList<User> users)

      • deserializeCM

        private void deserializeCM()

      • serializeCM

        private void serializeCM()
